page.title: 19A Typical Norton Family,1985
page.content: The typical family consists of two adults and two children. Shopping for the family is done on a Thursday or a Friday at the local supermarket. Mother may take one or both children with her, but Father only goes shopping occasionally. Some items of shopping are obtained from local shops but not on a regular basis. The family usually takes its summer holidays in the United Kingdom. Self catering holidays are very popular as well as being cheaper. The most usual sort of self catering holiday is in a caravan, a flat or a cottage. A hotel is only a second choice. The family will often discuss the needs within the area, particularly for recreation. Other complaints are the amount of new building taking place, the volume of traffic on the road, and the problem of increasing unemployment.
